poem:
Title: A Morning Note From the World's Stage

The morning's tale, woven with strife and sorrow,
children of war dine on despair, tomorrow unknown.
Jets stitch the sky, leaving scars on the land below,
homes crumble, crops wither, in agonizing tableau.
Beneath the UN's blue line, the displaced linger on,
In the chorus of conflict, innocence is a pawn.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East crisis live: Unicef warns of soaring levels of child deaths in Gaza due to malnutrition 11.00am GMT Israel’s military has said in a statement that “throughout the morning, IDF fighter jets struck a number of Hezbollah terror targets in Lebanon.” Lebanese state media is reporting an increased number of people displaced from the UN-drawn blue line that divides Lebanon and Israel. It reports there has been “significant damage to homes, crops, and infrastructure,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
